title: CHECK_XML | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: Checks the validity of an XML document. If the input string is NULL or a valid XML document, the output is NULL. In case of an XML parsing error, the output string contains the error message.
This expression should evaluate to a VARCHAR. The VARCHAR should contain valid XML.
Specify the same value that you pass to the PARSE_XML function.
The data type of the returned value is VARCHAR.

You must either specify all arguments by name or by position. You cannot specify some of the arguments by name and other
arguments by position.
When specifying an argument by name, you cannot use double quotes around the argument name.
